post_text: TUSD will be changing its curbside pick-up days and times. Friday, August 28, 2020 will be the last day for our normal 5-day a week curbside pick-up. As a continued commitment to providing nutritious meals to our students, we will be transitioning to a once a week pick-up that will begin on Monday, August 31, 2020. The once a week pick-up will have a 5-day meal kit that will include your child’s breakfast and lunch meals for the 5-day school week. We are encouraging those that are remotely learning to participate in this pick-up service. The pick-up hours for Huachuca City School will be from 7:30-8:00 A.M. The pick-up hours for Tombstone will be at Walter J. Meyer from 8:15-8:45 A.M. This pick-up service will be every Monday until further notice. Please keep in mind that cafeteria staff will have to verify student enrollment in our district as well as eligibility before releasing any food items. As always, if you have any questions regarding foodservice, don’t hesitate to reach out to myself, one of the cafeteria staff or the administrators at your perspective schools.

Purchases have been made to provide surplus cleaning/antiviral supplies at each of our schools.

Any student sent to the office and found to have fever, a call will be place to pick up your student immediately.
We can all help by washing and disinfecting hands often, and practicing good daily hygiene practices.

shared_text:
Tombstone High School JROTC
February 7 at 8:23 PM ·

As I sit in the hotel and reflect on the day of shooting, I can't even start to tell you how proud I am of all 7 shooters today. Not everyone shot a personal best. We ran into a few unexpected issues that we have never encountered before and everyone kept their heads up and pushed through. Even those that did not meet their own expectations did their best. Tomorrow is another day, and hopefully we can repeat today's amazing results. Regardless of the final scores, whether we put anyone in the finals or on the podium, I already consider this trip a monumental success. These cadets have shown tremendous growth, but in shooting and personally. I am proud to be their coach.

Parents/Guardians/Friends,
This morning on a TUSD bus route, a student showed a toy gun key-chain to friends. This toy sparked interest with a few of the other students, and the bus driver was notified.
The bus driver contacted school administration as well as local law enforcement to make sure the situation was dealt with properly.

Please understand, the toy was not used in an aggressive manner and at no time was anyone in danger.

TUSD would like to use this as a learning opportunity for students so that they understand the severity of bringing anything that can be interpreted as a weapon. With Halloween quickly approaching, please talk with your students about not bringing weapon costume props to school.
